name: ICN
desc: Illinois Case Number (ICN) is a unique identifier assigned to each crash by the Crash Information System (CIS).  It is used to link records between the Crash, Vehicle, and Person levels.  At the Crash level, the ICN will appear one time for each crash.  At the Vehicle and Person levels, the ICN may appear multiple times depending on the number of vehicles and persons involved with the crash.  ICN’s for years prior to 2010 may be eight or 12 characters, while ICN’s for years 2010 and later are 12 characters.  For ICN’s with eight characters, the first character represents the year of the crash.  For ICN’s with 12 characters, the first four characters represent the year of the crash.

name: CrashID
desc: Similar in function to the ICN, the CrashID is a unique identifier assigned to each crash by CIS.  The CrashID is included in the Crash level and will appear once for each crash.  Statewide crash data extract files do not include the CrashID at the Vehicle and Person levels.  County and City crash data extract files may or may not include the CrashID at the Vehicle and Person level, depending on the extract year.  It is advised that you check the extract files prior to import to determine field position.

name: CrashReportUnitNbr
desc: Number which identifies each unit involved in the crash.

name: VIN11
desc: First 11 characters of the Vehicle Identification Number.

name: NbrOccupants
desc: Number of persons in vehicle—driver plus passengers.

name: VehTypeCode
desc: Code for type of vehicle involved in crash.

name: VehUseCode
desc: Code for how the vehicle type was used.

name: VehDefectsCode
desc: Code for vehicle defects contributing to crash.

name: VehManeuverPriorCode
desc: Code for vehicle maneuver prior to crash.

name: DirectionPriorTravelCode
desc: Code for Direction vehicle was travelling prior to crash.

name: IsTowed
desc: Vehicle towed/not towed due to crash.

name: IsFire
desc: Vehicle fire/no fire as result of crash.

name: IsHazMatSpill
desc: Vehicle leaking/not leaking hazardous materials.  Removed from page 1 of the 2013 SR 1050 form and is derived from the Commercial Motor Vehicle portion on page 2

name: IsCommercial
desc: Vehicle is/is not a commercial vehicle.

name: EventMostSevereCode
desc: Code for most severe event in the sequence of events (SOE).

name: EventMostSevereLocCode
desc: Code for location of the vehicle when the most harmful event took place.

name: MostHarmfulEventNo
desc: Of the three SOE’s, which was the most harmful (1, 2, or 3).

name: CrashEvent1Code
desc: Code for first event of vehicle in SOE.

name: CrashEvent2Code
desc: Code for second event of vehicle in SOE.

name: CrashEvent3Code
desc: Code for third event of vehicle in SOE.

name: Event1LocCode
desc: Code for location of vehicle at first event.

name: Event2LocCode
desc: Code for location of vehicle at second event.

name: Event3LocCode
desc: Code for location of vehicle at third event.

name: VehPointOfFirstContactCode
desc: Code for area of vehicle where first contact was made.

name: DirectionPriorTravel
desc: Text for field 10

name: VehDefects
desc: Text for field 8

name: VehManeuverPrior
desc: Text for field 9

name: VehType
desc: Text for field 6

name: VehUse
desc: Text for field 7

name: EventMostSevere
desc: Text for field 17

name: EventMostSevereLoc
desc: Text for field 18

name: CrashEvent1
desc: Text for field 20

name: CrashEvent2
desc: Text for field 21

name: CrashEvent3
desc: Text for field 22

name: Event1Loc
desc: Text for field 23

name: Event2Loc
desc: Text for field 24

name: Event3Loc
desc: Text for field 25

name: VehYear
desc: Four digit year for Vehicle Model

name: VehMake
desc: Text for Vehicle Make

name: VehModel
desc: Text for Vehicle Model

name: ExceedingSpeedLimit
desc: Vehicle did/did not exceed speed limit.    Added 2013
